Pack Tactics.description: Has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of its allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

Keen Hearing and Smell.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
Keen Hearing and Smell.description: Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

Aggressive.name: Aggressive
Aggressive.description: As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

Font of Magic.name: Font of Magic
Font of Magic.description:
You tap into a deep wellspring of magic within yourself. This wellspring is represented by sorcery points, which allow you to create a variety of magical effects.

You have 2 sorcery points, and you gain one additional point every time you level up, to a maximum of 20 at level 20. You can never have more sorcery points than shown on the table for your level. You regain all spent sorcery points when you finish a long rest.

You can use a bonus action to convert your spell slots and sorcery points at the conversion rates below:

Level 1 Slot - 2 Sorcery Points
Level 2 Slot - 3 Sorcery Points
Level 3 Slot - 5 Sorcery Points
Level 4 Slot - 6 Sorcery Points
Level 5 Slot - 7 Sorcery Points

Sorcerous Restoration.name: Sorcerous Restoration
Sorcerous Restoration.description: You regain your expended sorcery points whenever you finish a short rest.

Metamagic: Empowered Spell.name: Metamagic: Empowered Spell
Metamagic: Empowered Spell.description: This metamagic feature allows you to spend 2 sorcery points to roll the damage dice of your next spell with advantage.

Metamagic: Distant Spell.name: Metamagic: Distant Spell
Metamagic: Distant Spell.description: This metamagic feature allows you to spend 1 sorcery point to double the range of your next spell, if the spell has a range of touch (5ft) its range is instead increased to 30ft.

Metamagic: Extended Spell.name: Metamagic: Extended Spell
Metamagic: Extended Spell.description: This metamagic feature allows you to spend 1 sorcery point to double the duration of any conditions your next spell applies.

Metamagic: Quickened Spell.name: Metamagic: Quickened Spell
Metamagic: Quickened Spell.description: This metamagic feature allows you to spend 1 sorcery points to halve the cast time of your next spell.

Metamagic: Transmute Spells.name: Metamagic: Transmute Spells
Metamagic: Transmute Spells.description:
This metamagic feature allows you to spend 2 sorcery points so that the damage from your spells is changed to the chosen element of: acid, cold, fire, lighting, poison, thunder.

This effect lasts until disabled.

Pact of the Blade.name: Pact of the Blade
Pact of the Blade.description:
Through their pact, the warlock is granted martial prowess directly from their patron. This feature allows the warlock to use their Charisma modifier for attack rolls and damage rolls with any martial weapon they wield, replacing the need for Strength or Dexterity. This makes them fully capable of fighting in the front line while still benefiting from their primary spellcasting attribute.

Additionally, starting at 5th level, the warlock gains the Extra Attack feature, allowing them to make two weapon attacks whenever they take the Attack action.

Soul Reaper.name: Soul Reaper
Soul Reaper.description:
When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points, you trade its soul for temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier + your warlock level.

Starting at level 11, this feature also heals by half as much.

Invocation: Armor of Shadows.name: Invocation: Armor of Shadows
Invocation: Armor of Shadows.description: You can cast mage armor on yourself at will.

Invocation: Devil's Sight.name: Invocation: Devil's Sight
Invocation: Devil's Sight.description: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet.

Invocation: Eldritch Mind.name: Invocation: Eldritch Mind
Invocation: Eldritch Mind.description: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws that you make to maintain your concentration on a spell.

Invocation: Fiendish Vigor.name: Invocation: Fiendish Vigor
Invocation: Fiendish Vigor.description: You can cast false life on yourself at will.

Invocation: Lifedrinker.name: Invocation: Lifedrinker
Invocation: Lifedrinker.description: When you hit a creature with your pact weapon, the creature takes extra necrotic damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1).

Invocation: Maddening Hex.name: Invocation: Maddening Hex
Invocation: Maddening Hex.description: As a bonus action, you cause a psychic disturbance around the target cursed by your hex spell or by a warlock feature of yours, such as Hexblade's Curse and Sign of Ill Omen. When you do so, you deal psychic damage to the cursed target and each creature of your choice within 5 feet of it. The psychic damage equals your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 damage). To use this invocation, you must be able to see the cursed target, and it must be within 30 feet of you.

Invocation: Eldritch Smite.name: Invocation: Eldritch Smite
Invocation: Eldritch Smite.description:
When you hit a creature with a weapon, you can expend a warlock spell slot to deal an extra 3d8 force damage to the target.

This damage is increased by a further 1d8 on levels 7, 9 and 11.

Invocation: Shroud of Shadow.name: Invocation: Shroud of Shadow
Invocation: Shroud of Shadow.description: You can cast invisibility at will, without expending a spell slot.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
You know how to strike subtly and exploit a foe's distraction. Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. The attack must use a finesse or a ranged weapon.

You can make an additional sneak attack when you kill a target.

You don't need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't incapacitated, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

The amount of the extra damage increases as you gain levels in this class, as shown in the Sneak Attack column of the Rogue table.

class: Tongue of the Sun and the Moon

Monk: Tongue of the Sun and the Moon

13: Tongue of the Sun and the Moon

false: Tongue of the Sun and the Moon

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description: Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be paralyzed for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.
Hold Person.description_higher_levels: This spell can target one additional humanoid when your spellcasting level reaches: 5, 7, and 9.

Darkvision.name: Darkvision
Darkvision.description: You touch a willing creature to grant it the ability to see in the dark. For the duration, that creature has darkvision out to a range of 30 feet.

Haste.name: Haste
Haste.description:
Choose a willing creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, the target’s speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it gains an additional action on each of its turns.

When the spell ends, the target can’t move or take actions until after its next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over it.

Hold Monster.name: Hold Monster
Hold Monster.description: Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be paralyzed for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.
Hold Monster.description_higher_levels: This spell can target one additional creature when your spellcasting level reaches: 11, 13, and 15.

Magic Missile.name: Magic Missile
Magic Missile.description: You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals 1d4 + 1 force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.
Magic Missile.description_higher_levels: This spell can create one additional missile when your spellcasting level reaches: 3, 5, and 7.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +3 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.
Shield.description_higher_levels: The bonus of this spell is increased by +1 when your spellcasting level reaches: 3, 5, and 7.

Misty Step.name: Misty Step
Misty Step.description: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see.

Melf's Minute Meteors.name: Melf's Minute Meteors
Melf's Minute Meteors.description: You create six tiny meteors in your space. They float in the air and orbit you for the spell’s duration. When you cast the spell — and as a bonus action on each of your turns thereafter — you can expend one or two of the meteors, sending them streaking toward a point or points you choose within 60 feet of you. Once a meteor reaches its destination or impacts against a solid surface, the meteor explodes. Each creature within 5 feet of the point where the meteor explodes must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 2d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Melf's Minute Meteors.description_higher_levels: The number of meteors increases by two when your spellcasting level reaches: 7, 9, and 11.

Shatter.name: Shatter
Shatter.description: A sudden loud ringing noise, painfully intense, erupts from a point of your choice within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 3d8 thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Shatter.description_higher_levels: The damage of this spell increases by 1d8 when your spellcasting level reaches: 5, 7, and 9.

Cone of Cold.name: Cone of Cold
Cone of Cold.description: A blast of cold air erupts from your hands. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 8d8 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature killed by this spell becomes a frozen statue until it thaws.
Cone of Cold.description_higher_levels: The damage of this spell is increased by 1d8 when your spellcasting level reaches: 11, 13, and 15.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one creature. Until the spell ends, the creature sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. Completely covering the creature with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action.

If you target an object held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity DC of 10 + your spell modifier to avoid the spell.

Lightning Streak.name: Lightning Streak
Lightning Streak.description:
Lightning jumps from your hand to a target within range, the target must succeed on a DC 10 + your spell modifier, on a fail the target receives 1d4 lightning damage, and the lightning jumps to the closest creature within 15ft. 

The lightning can't jump twice on the same creature, and will only stop on a successful saving throw, or if there are no more creatures within range.

The damage dealt by this spell is increased by your spellcasting modifier.

Sacred Flame.name: Sacred Flame
Sacred Flame.description: Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 radiant damage. The damage dealt is increased by your spellcasting modifier.

Guidance.name: Guidance
Guidance.description: You touch one willing creature. Once before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to one ability check of its choice. It can roll the die before or after making the ability check. The spell then ends.

Fire Bolt.name: Fire Bolt
Fire Bolt.description: You hurl a mote of fire at a creature or object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn’t being worn or carried. The damage dealt by this spell is increased by your spellcasting modifier.
Fire Bolt.description_higher_levels: The damage of this spell increases by 1d6 when your spellcasting level reaches: 5, 11, and 17.

Eldritch Blast.name: Eldritch Blast
Eldritch Blast.description: A beam of crackling energy streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 force damage. The damage dealt by this spell is increased by your spellcasting modifier.
Eldritch Blast.description_higher_levels: The spell creates more than one beam when you reach higher levels: two beams at 5th level, three beams at 11th level, and four beams at 17th level. You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam.

Stoneskin.name: Stoneskin
Stoneskin.description:
You touch a willing creature, and their skin takes on a stone-like resilience. The target becomes immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from all sources for the three times they are hit by such damage during the spell’s duration.

Each qualifying hit negates all physical damage from that attack as the stone skin absorbs the blow. After the third hit, the effect ends early.

This spell has no effect against non-damaging physical effects, such as grapples or being shoved, nor does it protect against magical effects that do not deal bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage.
Stoneskin.description_higher_levels: The number of attacks absorbed by this spell increases by one when your spellcasting level reaches: 9, 11, and 13.

Hunter's Mark.name: Hunter's Mark
Hunter's Mark.description:
You choose a creature you can see within range and mystically mark it as your quarry. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 damage to the target whenever you hit it with a weapon attack, and you have advantage on any Wisdom (Perception) or Wisdom (Survival) check you make to find it.

If the target drops to 0 hit points before this spell ends, you can use a bonus action on a subsequent turn of yours to mark a new creature.

Bane.name: Bane
Bane.description: Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must make Charisma saving throws. Whenever a target that fails this saving throw makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.
Bane.description_higher_levels: This spell can target one additional creature when your spellcasting level reaches: 3, 5, and 7.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description: You bless up to three creatures of your choice within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.
Bless.description_higher_levels: This spell can target one additional creature when your spellcasting level reaches: 3, 5, and 7.

Faerie Fire.name: Faerie Fire
Faerie Fire.description:
Each object in a 20-foot cube within range is outlined in violet light.

Any creature in the area when the spell is cast is also outlined in light if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed dim light in a 10-foot radius.

Any attack roll against an affected creature or object has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the affected creature or object can’t benefit from being invisible.

Cure Wounds.name: Cure Wounds
Cure Wounds.description: A creature of your choice that you can touch regains hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
Cure Wounds.description_higher_levels: The healing of this spell increases by 1d8 when your spellcasting level reaches: 3, 5, and 7.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description: A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains hit points equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
Healing Word.description_higher_levels: The healing of this spell increases by 1d4 when your spellcasting level reaches: 3, 5, and 7.

Blur.name: Blur
Blur.description: Your body becomes blurred, shifting and wavering to all who can see you. For the duration, any creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you. An attacker is immune to this effect if it doesn't rely on sight, as with blindsight, or can see through illusions, as with truesight.

Mage Armor.name: Mage Armor
Mage Armor.description: You touch a willing creature who isn’t wearing armor, and a protective magical force surrounds it until the spell ends. The target’s base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description: A flash of light streaks toward a creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 4d6 radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of your next turn has advantage, thanks to the mystical dim light glittering on the target until then.
Guiding Bolt.description_higher_levels: The damage of this spell increases by 1d6 when your spellcasting level reaches: 3, 5, and 7.

Reveal Invisibility.name: Reveal Invisibility
Reveal Invisibility.description: You reveal all invisible creatures in a 60ft radius around you.

Imbue Weapon.name: Imbue Weapon
Imbue Weapon.description:
You touch a creature. Until the spell ends, the creature's weapons are imbued with an element of your choice between acid, cold, fire, lightning and poison. That creature's attacks deal deal additional damage of that type equal to your spellcasting modifier.

The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it.

Ray of Frost.name: Ray of Frost
Ray of Frost.description: A frigid beam of blue-white light streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes 1d4 cold damage, and its speed is halved until the start of your next turn. The damage dealt by this spell is increased by your spellcasting modifier.
Ray of Frost.description_higher_levels: The damage of this spell increases by 1d4 when your spellcasting level reaches: 5, 11, and 17.

Vicious Mockery.name: Vicious Mockery
Vicious Mockery.description: You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at a creature you can see within range. If the target can hear you (though it need not understand you), it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d4 psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn. The damage dealt by this spell is increased by your spellcasting modifier.
Vicious Mockery.description_higher_levels: The damage of this spell increases by 1d4 when your spellcasting level reaches: 5, 11, and 17.

Burning Hands.name: Burning Hands
Burning Hands.description:
As you hold your hands with thumbs touching and fingers spread, a thin sheet of flames shoots forth from your outstretched fingertips. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 3d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried.
Burning Hands.description_higher_levels: The damage of this spell increases by 1d6 when your spellcasting level reaches: 3, 5, and 7.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description: A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 6d6 fire damage on a failed save,  or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.
Fireball.description_higher_levels: The damage of this spell is increased by 2d6 when your spellcasting level reaches: 7, 9, and 11.

Blindness.name: Blindness
Blindness.description: Choose one creature that you can see within range to make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, the target is blinded for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.
Blindness.description_higher_levels: This spell can target one additional creature when your spellcasting level reaches: 5, 7, and 9.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description: A creature you touch becomes invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on the target's person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.
Invisibility.description_higher_levels: This spell can target one additional creature when your spellcasting level reaches: 5, 7, and 9.

Hellish Rebuke.name: Hellish Rebuke
Hellish Rebuke.description: You point your finger, and the creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by hellish flames. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes 2d10 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Hellish Rebuke.description_higher_levels: The damage of this spell increases by 1d10 when your spellcasting level reaches: 3, 5, and 7.

Hex.name: Hex
Hex.description:
You place a curse on a creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 necrotic damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack. Also, choose one ability when you cast the spell. The target has disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability.

If the target drops to 0 hit points before this spell ends, you can use a bonus action on a subsequent turn of yours to curse a new creature.

A Remove Curse cast on the target ends this spell early.

Arms of Hadar.name: Arms of Hadar
Arms of Hadar.description: You invoke the power of Hadar, the Dark Hunger. Tendrils of dark energy erupt from you and batter all creatures within 10 feet of you. Each creature in that area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 2d8 necrotic damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage, but suffers no other effect.
Arms of Hadar.description_higher_levels: The damage of this spell increases by 1d8 when your spellcasting level reaches: 3, 5, and 7.

Frostbite.name: Frostbite
Frostbite.description: You cause numbing frost to form on one creature that you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 1d4 cold damage, and it has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes. The damage dealt by this spell is increased by your spellcasting modifier.
Frostbite.description_higher_levels: The damage of this spell increases by 1d4 when your spellcasting level reaches: 5, 11, and 17.

False Life.name: False Life
False Life.description: Bolstering yourself with a necromantic facsimile of life, you gain 1d4 + your spellcasting modifier temporary hit points for the duration.
False Life.description_higher_levels: The potency of this spell increases by 1d4 when your spellcasting level reaches: 3, 5, and 7.

Splint Armor.name: Splint Armor
Splint Armor.description: This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible chain mail protects the joints.

Chain Mail.name: Chain Mail
Chain Mail.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

Ring Mail.name: Ring Mail
Ring Mail.description: This armor is leather armor with heavy rings sewn into it. The rings help reinforce the armor against blows from swords and axes. Ring mail is inferior to chain mail, and it's usually worn only by those who can't afford better armor.

Half Plate.name: Half Plate
Half Plate.description: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps.

Breastplate.name: Breastplate
Breastplate.description: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered.

Scale Mail.name: Scale Mail
Scale Mail.description: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets.

Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
Chain Shirt.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Hide Armor.name: Hide Armor
Hide Armor.description: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by Barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor.

Padded Armor.name: Padded Armor
Padded Armor.description: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.

Studded Leather.name: Studded Leather
Studded Leather.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
Leather Armor.description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Gold Coin.name: Gold Coin
Gold Coin.description: A common currency, worth 10 silver coins or 100 copper coins.

Platinum Coin.name: Platinum Coin
Platinum Coin.description: A common currency, worth 10 gold coins or 100 silver coins.

Silver Coin.name: Silver Coin
Silver Coin.description: A common currency, worth a tenth of a gold coin or 10 copper coins.

Copper Coin.name: Copper Coin
Copper Coin.description: A common currency, worth a hundredth of a gold coin or a tenth of a silver coin.

Plate Armor.name: Plate Armor
Plate Armor.description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

Dragon Scale Mail.name: Dragon Scale Mail
Dragon Scale Mail.description: Dragon scale mail is made of the scales of one kind of dragon. Sometimes dragons collect their cast-off scales and gift them to humanoids. Other times, hunters carefully skin and preserve the hide of a dead dragon.

Candle.name: Candle
Candle.description: For 1 hour, a candle sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet. Attacking with a candle deals 1 fire damage.

Hooded Lantern.name: Hooded Lantern
Hooded Lantern.description: A hooded lantern casts bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil. As an action, you can lower the hood, reducing the light to dim light in a 5-foot radius.

Torch.name: Torch
Torch.description: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1d4 fire damage.
